body.section:
Ceph Overview
Ceph is an Open Source, scalable, software defined storage running on HP Servers which provides block and object storage with unified management.
The HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 Ceph Storage Solution provides an unified scaleable and stable storage solution for the management of HP Helion OpenStack Volume Storage (Cinder persistent Volumes) service. The installation, configuration, and integration between HP Helion OpenStack: 2.0 and Ceph Firefly 0.80.7 running on the hlinux kernel 3.14.44-1 is detailed in ceph deployment page.
HP Helion OpenStack introduces the concept of cloud models, where the user can modify the YAML to provide the required configuration based on their environment. Therefore to deploy ceph and make configuration changes you must modify the YAML files related to ceph.
You can implementing the input model and perform the following Ceph activities:
Ceph Deployment
Add a new node operations
Configuring OpenStack service(s) to use Ceph cluster
Deploying monitor on standalone independent node
Reconfigure ceph service
Remove Node Operations
Ceph operations
Update and upgrade operations
body.p: You can also monitor ceph components and view the logs.
